app.database package¶

Submodules¶

app.database.engine module¶

class app.database.engine.MyEngine(test: bool = False, test_db: str = '')[source]¶

Bases: object

Creates engine and returns session Can be used to manipulate users directly without limitation. For example when creating user there is no need to care about length of the password.

Args: test (bool): if True swaps targeted database to one provided in test_db arg. test_db (str): database that should be targeted during tests

change_password(user_id: int, new_password: str) → None[source]¶
close_session() → None[source]¶

Closes session and dispose of engine

create_my_session() → scoped_session[source]¶

Creates engine and binds it to the session that is retuned by this function.

Returns:

scoped_session

create_user(username: str, password: str, *, hashpass: bool = True, admin: bool = False, with_taxes: bool = True) → User[source]¶

Allows for creation of user with any password :param username: username :type username: str :param password: password :type password: str :param hashpass: defualt True, hashes password and stores result instead of plain passowrd. :type hashpass: bool

Returns:

obj ‘User’

Raises:

UserCreationError – if username is taken.

default_taxes(user: User, *, path_to_file: str | None = None) → list[str][source]¶
delete_user(*, username: str | None = None, id_: int | None = None) → None[source]¶
get_user(username: str | None = None, user_id: int | None = None) → User | None[source]¶

Returns user from databse by name or id.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – if provided searches by name

  • user_id (int) – if provided searches by id, if both are provided username is first considered

Returns:

obj ‘User’
